page.title: 07 EVENTS
page.content: The main items of news in the Dartford Reporter dated 1/6/1985 were about an armed robbery on a Post Office Van, and about an old woman of 86 who was tricked out of 300 pounds by conmen. There was a major article about" The Fin and Kentish Maid" about a ceremony honouring some of the oldest human remains- over quarter of a million years old - which were found at Swanscombe near Dartford. The T.V. personality Magnus Magnusson unvailed a memorial tablet recalling the discovery of what used to be called Swanscombe Man and which should now perhaps be called Swanscombe Woman. Other articles in the papers concerned: Tributes made to a 78 year old dedicated chief executive officer who died on Saturday;And a choir visiting Dartford from the U.S.A.
